meanings.definition: To produce or release an abnormally large number of eggs during ovulation.
meanings.sent1: The hen was superovulating, resulting in a dozen eggs in one day.
meanings.sent2: The fertility treatment was successful in superovulating the patient, leading to multiple eggs being released.
meanings.sent3: The garden was superovulating with flowers, creating a colorful and vibrant display.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was superovulating ideas, coming up with a multitude of creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The factory was superovulating products, churning out a high volume of goods.

meanings.definition: The process of inducing or enhancing ovulation in order to increase the number of eggs released.
meanings.sent1: Superovulating can be a helpful method for couples struggling with infertility.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the benefits of superovulating to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The science lab was superovulating with activity, as researchers worked on new methods.
meanings.sent4: The market was superovulating with fresh produce, attracting many customers.
meanings.sent5: The competition was superovulating with excitement, as participants geared up for the challenge.
